required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PK and Safety Study of Vaginal Rings Containing Dapivirine and Levonorgestrel
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-Blind Pharmacokinetic and Safety Study of Dapivirine/Levonorgestrel Vaginal Rings

brief_summary.textblock: PK and Safety Study of Vaginal Ring Containing Dapivirine and Levonorgestrel

detailed_description.textblock: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-Blind Pharmacokinetic and Safety Study of Dapivirine/Levonorgestrel

primary_outcome.measure: Dapivirine and levonorgestrel concentrations in blood and Vaginal fluid
primary_outcome.description: To characterize the local and systemic pharmacokinetics of one dapivirine vaginal ring formulation and two dapivirine-levonorgestrel vaginal ring formulations used continuously for 14 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Grade 2 or higher Genitourinary adverse event and Grade 3 or higher adverse event as defined by DAIDS
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety of one dapivirine vaginal ring formulation and two dapivirine-levonorgestrel vaginal ring formulations used continuously for 14 days

arm_group.description: Each participant will receive a VR containing either 200 mg DPV or 200 mg DPV + 320 mg LNG. Participants will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio. The VR should be worn for approximately 14 consecutive days +/-1 day. The ring will be removed by the participant (or clinician/designee, if necessary) at the Product Use End Visit (PUEV)/Early Termination Visit. The participant will be followed for approximately 2 days following VR removal

Each participant will receive a VR containing either 200 mg DPV or 200 mg DPV + 320 mg LNG. Participants will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio. The VR should be worn for approximately 14 consecutive days +/-1 day. The ring will be removed by the participant (or clinician/designee, if necessary) at the Product Use End Visit (PUEV)/Early Termination Visit. The participant will be followed for approximately 2 days following VR removal

intervention.description: DPV-LNG VR, containing 200 mg of DPV + 320 mg LNG

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy women
Exclusion Criteria:
- HIV infected women
